title: Poll: 61 Percent Of Americans Support Military Action Against ISIS
teaser: The NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll results come as President Obama prepares to lay out his strategy to curb the militant group to the nation tonight.
contentencoded:
President Obama will give a rare primetime address tonight, to lay out his plan for fighting the extremist group calling itself the Islamic State, and is also known as ISIS.

A new NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll indicates that he will be speaking to a sympathetic audience: nearly two-thirds of Americans believe that it is in the country’s interest to take military action against ISIS.

Here & Now’s Robin Young talks to Mark Murray, senior political editor for NBC News about the poll’s findings.

  • NBC: ISIS Threat: Fear of Terror Attack Soars to 9/11 High, NBC News/WSJ Poll Finds

Guest

  • Mark Murray, senior political editor for NBC News. He tweets @mmurraypolitics.
